rev.comment: /* Night of Nov 9: OccupyCal at UC Berkeley */
rev.diff:
Line 353: Line 353:
While the camp was emptied of most of its protesters, Jean Quan used the opportunity to enter the Ogawa Plaza camp of 180 tents and held a small meeting with the remaining protesters. She later commented that she called upon the protest to disassociate itself from "violent demonstrators", and said of the meeting, "I hope that was a good beginning."<ref>Hollyfield, Amy [http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8424668 Protesters, city headed for showdown in Oakland] ''ABC KGO 7'' November 9, 2011</ref>
While the camp was emptied of most of its protesters, Jean Quan used the opportunity to enter the Ogawa Plaza camp of 180 tents and held a small meeting with the remaining protesters. She later commented that she called upon the protest to disassociate itself from "violent demonstrators", and said of the meeting, "I hope that was a good beginning."<ref>Hollyfield, Amy [http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8424668 Protesters, city headed for showdown in Oakland] ''ABC KGO 7'' November 9, 2011</ref>

====Night of Nov 9: OccupyCal at UC Berkeley====
+
====Night of Nov 9: Clashes and General Assembly at UC Berkeley====
{{ external media
{{ external media
| align = left
| align = left
Line 359: Line 359:
| video1= "[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=buovLQ9qyWQ Occupy Cal 11/9/11 ]" Police clash with students at UC Berkeley
| video1= "[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=buovLQ9qyWQ Occupy Cal 11/9/11 ]" Police clash with students at UC Berkeley
}} Oakland General Assembly had previously passed a statement of solidarity with the OccupyCal protest at the University of California Berkeley. In the evening of November 9, law enforcement from Oakland Police, Alameda County Sheriff, and UC Police attempted to evict the members of OccupyCal from their encampment on the campus. In line with the earlier general assembly vote, members of Occupy Oakland joined in the Berkeley protest.
}} Oakland General Assembly had previously passed a statement of solidarity with the OccupyCal protest at the University of California Berkeley. In the evening of November 9, law enforcement from Oakland Police, Alameda County Sheriff, and UC Police attempted to evict the members of OccupyCal from their encampment on the campus. In line with the earlier general assembly vote, members of Occupy Oakland joined in the Berkeley protest.
  +   +
After police had removed the tents from the group, protestors held a general assembly. It voted 569-31 for a General Strike to be held on Tuesday November 15, 2011.
